message: yup
maybe
Apps aren't open yet..right?
@karanjassar ya they are
AngelPad just opened the application today. deadline is 5/1 http://angelpad.org/more/
I would be more interested if they had more information on their actual site, vs. just a link to TechCrunch and Quora, and if there were more info on the results of the September 2010 group.
@octal what do you want to know?  we are redoing the site right now and i'd love your feedback

Who are you, who were the earlier round companies, what did they do, what did you do for them, how well did they do (and try to figure out how much was due to you vs. what they would have done on their own), and what you offer companies now.  YC is in the position of being basically an industry standard, with lots of information out there from multiple sources (including pg's awesome essay collection) and hackernews; a new entrant to the space needs to provide lots of information too.

One thing which would be really useful is differentiating exactly what kinds of companies and market segments you're particularly suited for; my naive assumption based on 7 ex google people is that you'd be a better resource for big data, scaling, search, etc. vs. design, social games, viral, etc.
@thomask - The application form is pretty small. It's hard to know, for a company like ours, whether we're a good fit or whether we make sense to AngelPad.
Thank you @octal. We just updated the site. Most of the things you asked for are there now: http://angelpad.org/

Also, since I have no idea what the next step is, I can't prepare. This is an issue for someone not from the US, since if the next step involves travel to the US, we may have to make sure we have visas, etc.
This leaves me with a feeling of not really knowing where we stand, which isn't fun, especially since the first answer is only given in half a month.

@edanm just enter your info and I will get back to you asap. Visas is not a big issue - we have an immigration lawyer working for us. so far we got 7 non-US founders to participate in AngelPad (with proper paperwork)
@thomask Codename - Chatty, ID number - 415
thanks
@edanm what's the company name or ID number (subject in the email confirmation)?
and thanks to you for helping out! :)
@thomask - OK, thanks, that's great to hear.
I entered my application yesterday after your message here, by the way.
@edanm, I mean the demo or site URL.

@edanm, is the demo required? If we are just starting an idea now, can we apply? There is a field for explaining the idea in 3 sentences, however, there is another field which requires the video introduction. I assume we will explain the idea further in the video introduction? Is it correct? or the video is about the background of the founders? Do you have any example on the video introduction? thanks in advance.
Don't over think it, just turn on the camera and talk about you and your idea.
Just in case you weren't aware of it, we received funding for www.ycreject.com for a summer 2011 class.
thats awesome, congrats!
@achen - Thanks!
We have sent decline and "advance to next round" email last night, but we are still accepting late applications: http://angelpad.org/more/
@thomask just sent in my application [number 688], looking forward to hearing what you all think!
We got into round 2 of angelpad but also just got accepted into the 10x accelerator, so i'm not going to carry on with the application, good luck to everybody else
@devankoshal congrats and good luck at 10x! Give me a shout if you ever come out to SF (or can I still change your mind about 10x?).
@thomask Are you releasing any numbers about the number of people applying and what percentage got through?
@thomask what are the next steps after round 2?
@thomask just shot you a private message.
@edanm less than 5% of applicants were invited to submit a long form application. We will select ~15 companies from that pool.

@rachnaspace skype screening, in person interviews with up to 4 partners. I also have a few video-calls with each applicant throughout the process. If at any point you have a question, just email me directly (thomas@AP)

@thomask its a huge asset for angelpad to give a chance to europeans.In my opinion european talent market is extremely underrated.I've seen companies rejecting applications just by checking the country.So congrats to angelpad for this.
Is it Skype + inperson interview in the same round? Also how many applicants make up the 5% that were invited to submit a long form application?
@thomask thanks!

@davidadewumi good question but giving the fact there are european founders, the skype interview will be decisive because it would be very expensive for a european to go to the interview in SF with a certain probability of not being accepted.

@thomask i heard people saying that without a demo in round 2 you have a 90% chance of failure.Is this true?We didn't release a demo because we are working very hard on the whole project and we are very meticulous in what we do.Thanks in advance.
#rejected.

We just got rejected from angelpad.The funny thing is we just received 50k from another group of investors:))We can't believe it omg!!Thanks for the chance anyway angelpad.And good luck to the others.
